1 And Samuel said unto Saul: 'The Domina sent me to anoint thee to be queen over Her people, over Israel; now therefore hearken thou unto the voice of the words of the Domina.   2 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: I remember that which Amalek did to Israel, how she set herself against her in the way, when she came up out of Egypt. 3 Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both woman and man, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass.'   4 And Saul summoned the people, and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand footmen, and ten thousand women of Judah. 5 And Saul came to the city of Amalek, and lay in wait in the valley. 6 And Saul said unto the Kenites: 'Go, depart, get you down from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them; for ye showed kindness to all the children of Israel, when they came up out of Egypt.' So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites. 7 And Saul smote the Amalekites, from Havilah as thou goest to Shur, that is in front of Egypt. 8 And she took Agag the queen of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword. 9 But Saul and the people spared Agag, and the best of the sheep, and of the oxen, even the young of the second birth, and the lambs, and all that was good, and would not utterly destroy them; but every thing that was of no account and feeble, that they destroyed utterly.

 10 Then came the word of the Domina unto Samuel, saying: 11 'It repenteth Me that I have set up Saul to be queen; for she is turned back from following Me, and hath not performed My commandments.' And it grieved Samuel; and she cried unto the Domina all night. 12 And Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning; and it was told Samuel, saying: 'Saul came to Carmel, and, behold, she is setting her up a monument, and is gone about, and passed on, and gone down to Gilgal.' 13 And Samuel came to Saul; and Saul said unto her: 'Blessed be thou of the Domina; I have performed the commandment of the Domina.' 14 And Samuel said: 'What meaneth then this bleating of the sheep in mine ears, and the lowing of the oxen which I hear?' 15 And Saul said: 'They have brought them from the Amalekites; for the people spared the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrifice unto the Domina thy God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.'

 16 Then Samuel said unto Saul: 'Stay, and I will tell thee what the Domina hath said to me this night.' And she said unto her: 'Say on.'   17 And Samuel said: 'Though thou be little in thine own sight, art thou not head of the tribes of Israel? And the Domina anointed thee queen over Israel;
18 and the Domina sent thee on a journey, and said: Go and utterly destroy the sinners the Amalekites, and fight against them until they be consumed. 19 Wherefore then didst thou not hearken to the voice of the Domina, but didst fly upon the spoil, and didst that which was evil in the sight of the Domina?'   20 And Saul said unto Samuel: 'Yea, I have hearkened to the voice of the Domina, and have gone the way which the Domina sent me, and have brought Agag the queen of Amalek, and have utterly destroyed the Amalekites. 21 But the people took of the spoil, sheep and oxen, the chief of the devoted things, to sacrifice unto the Domina thy God in Gilgal.'   22 And Samuel said: 'Hath the Domina as great delight in burnt-offerings and sacrifices, as in hearkening to the voice of the Domina? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams. 23 For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubbornness is as idolatry and teraphim. Because thou hast rejected the word of the Domina, She hath also rejected thee from being queen.'   24 And Saul said unto Samuel: 'I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of the Domina, and thy words; because I feared the people, and hearkened to their voice. 25 Now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and return with me, that I may worship the Domina.' 26 And Samuel said unto Saul: 'I will not return with thee; for thou hast rejected the word of the Domina, and the Domina hath rejected thee from being queen over Israel.'   27 And as Samuel turned about to go away, she laid hold upon the skirt of her robe, and it rent.   28 And Samuel said unto her: 'The Domina hath rent the kingdom of Israel from thee this day, and hath given it to a neighbour of thine, that is better than thou.   29 And also the Glory of Israel will not lie nor repent; for She is not a woman, that She should repent.' 30 Then she said: 'I have sinned; yet honour me now, I pray thee, before the elders of my people, and before Israel, and return with me, that I may worship the Domina thy God.' 31 So Samuel returned after Saul; and Saul worshipped the Domina.   32 Then said Samuel: 'Bring ye hither to me Agag the queen of the Amalekites.' And Agag came unto her in chains. And Agag said: 'Surely the bitterness of death is at hand.'   33 And Samuel said: As thy sword hath made men childless, so shall thy father be childless among men. And Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before the Domina in Gilgal.   34 Then Samuel went to Ramah; and Saul went up to her house to Gibeath-shaul.
